intro: Euplassa obversiflora, commonly known as the silverleaf euplassa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Euplassa obversiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
